citation.article-title: Rhodoplanes pokkaliisoli sp. nov., a phototrophic alphaproteobacterium isolated from a waterlogged brackish paddy soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodoplanes pokkaliisoli sp. nov.

Rhodoplanes pokkaliisoli (pok.ka.li.i.so′li. N.L. n. pokkalium pokkali (a variety of rice); L. n. solum soil; N.L. gen. n. pokkaliisoli of/from the soil of a pokkali field, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are rod-shaped, 1.0–1.2 μm wide and 3.0–5.0 μm long.
Cells are motile by means of a single polar flagellum and multiply by budding and asymmetrical cell division without forming prosthecae.
Cells form chains, but are also capable of associating with each other such that they form characteristic T, Y and V shapes and rosettes.
Internal photosynthetic membranes are present as lamellar stacks parallel to the cytoplasmic membrane.
Phototrophically grown cultures are yellowish brown, whereas aerobic cultures are white.
The in vivo absorption spectrum of intact cells in sucrose exhibits maxima at 380, 464, 491, 527, 596, 800 and 866 nm.
Bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids of the spirilloxanthin series (rhodopin, methyl rhodopin, lycopene and a few unidentified spirilloxanthins) are present.
The type strain is mesophilic (range 25–30 °C) and grows at an optimum salinity (NaCl) of 1.5 % (range 0–2.5 %, w/v) and pH 7 (range pH 6.0–7.5).
Growth occurs under anaerobic conditions in the light (photo-organoheterotrophy) or under aerobic conditions in the dark (chemo-organoheterotrophy).
The preferred mode of growth is photo-organoheterotrophy with a few organic compounds.
Acetate, butyrate, lactate, pyruvate, malate, fumarate, succinate, glycerol and crotonate are good carbon sources.

2-Oxoglutarate, valerate, caproate, ethanol, butanol, propanol, formate, caprylate, propionate, citrate, glycolate, benzoate, glucose, fructose, gluconate, mannitol, tartrate, aspartate, sucrose, methanol, sorbitol, leucine, alanine, peptone, Casamino acids and yeast extract are not utilized.
Photoautotrophic and chemoautotrophic growth do not occur with thiosulfate, H2, sulfide, sulfur, sulfite or thioglycolate as the electron donor.
Chemotrophic growth by denitrification under anoxic conditions in the dark in the presence of nitrate is observed.
Fermentative growth does not take place in the presence of glucose, fructose or pyruvate as fermentable carbon source.
Ammonium salts and glutamate are used as good nitrogen sources.
Sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate and methionine are used as sulfur sources.
Niacin, pantothenate and p-aminobenzoate are required as growth factors.
The predominant cellular fatty acid component is C18 : 1ω7c.
Ubiquinone-10 and rhodoquinone-10 are present as major quinones.
The type strain is JA415T (=NBRC 104972T =KCTC 5711T), which was isolated from a soil sample from a pokkali rice field located on Vypeen Island, Ernakulam, Kerala, on the west coast of India.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.2 mol% (HPLC).
